foods.recipe: Butter Chicken is a popular Indian dish made with tender chicken cooked in a rich and creamy tomato-based gravy. The chicken is marinated in a mixture of yogurt and spices, then cooked in a buttery tomato sauce with the addition of cream and aromatic spices.

Biryani is a fragrant rice dish made with basmati rice, meat (such as chicken, mutton, or beef), and a blend of aromatic spices. The rice and meat are cooked separately and then layered together, creating a flavorful and aromatic one-pot meal.

Paneer Tikka is a popular vegetarian appetizer made with chunks of paneer (Indian cottage cheese) marinated in a spicy yogurt-based marinade and grilled until charred and smoky. It is often served with mint chutney.

Dosa is a thin and crispy South Indian crepe made from fermented rice and lentil batter. It is typically served with sambar (a lentil-based vegetable stew) and coconut chutney. Dosas come in various types, including plain dosa, masala dosa, and paper dosa.

Chole Bhature is a popular North Indian dish consisting of spicy chickpea curry (chole) served with deep-fried bread (bhature). The chickpeas are cooked in a flavorful onion-tomato gravy, while the bhature is made with a dough of refined flour and yogurt.

Tandoori Chicken is a popular Indian dish made with marinated chicken that is cooked in a clay oven called a tandoor. The chicken is marinated in a mixture of yogurt and spices, which gives it a vibrant red color and a smoky flavor.

Palak Paneer is a vegetarian dish made with paneer (Indian cottage cheese) cooked in a spinach-based gravy. The paneer cubes are simmered in a flavorful blend of spinach, onions, tomatoes, and spices, resulting in a creamy and nutritious dish.

Gulab Jamun is a popular Indian sweet made from khoya (reduced milk) and deep-fried until golden brown. The fried balls are then soaked in a sugar syrup flavored with cardamom and rose water, resulting in soft and syrupy sweet treats.

Rogan Josh is a flavorful Kashmiri curry made with tender chunks of meat (typically lamb or goat) cooked in a rich and aromatic gravy. The dish is known for its deep red color and a blend of spices that include Kashmiri red chili powder, ginger, garlic, and fennel seeds.

Masala Dosa is a popular South Indian dish consisting of a crispy dosa filled with a spiced potato filling. The dosa batter is spread thin on a hot griddle, and once cooked, the potato masala is placed in the center and the dosa is folded over it.
